About the Inference Project

The inference package began its life as the software component of an Inference project supported by NASA's Applied Information Sciences Research (AISR) Program via grant NAG5-12082, ending in Spring 2006. The investigators for the Inference project were astronomers Tom Loredo (PI, Cornell University) and Alanna Connors (Eureka Scientific), and engineer Travis Oliphant (then at Brigham Young University; Oliphant later worked for Enthought and then founded Anaconda). Besides developing tools for astrostatistics, the Inference Project also supported Oliphant's early work developing Python's NumPy and SciPy packages, which the inference package heavily relies on. In particular, much of Oliphant's early work on statistical distributions in SciPy was supported by this project

Subsequent development of the package has been led by Loredo. Support for some additions came from NASA's Swift mission Guest Investigator program (grant NNG06GH84G) and from the (now defunct) SIM-Lite mission (via its EPIcS key project, its 2008 double-blind data analysis exercise, and the SIM Science Studies program).

Most recently, major updates and additions to the inference package have been supported by NASA'a Astrophysics Data Analysis Program (ADAP) via grant NNX16AL02G.
